place.name: MORNING THORPE
place.gazetteerText: MORNING-THORPE, a parish in Depwade district, Norfolk; 3 miles E of Forncett r. station, and 7¾ WNW of Bun gay. Post town, Long Stratton. Acres, 1,001. Real property, £2,049. Pop., 140. Houses, 32. The property is not much divided. The manor of MorningThorpe belongs to E. Howes, Esq.; and that of Boyland, with Boyland Hall, belongs to F. W. Irby, Esq. B. Hall is a fine Tudor mansion of 1551, and stands in a large and well-wooded park, with an alcove containing, over its entrance-porch, a bust of queen Elizabeth, brought from Tilbury House. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Valne, £300. * Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church consists of nave and chancel, with a round tower; and has a fine memorial window to the late Admiral Irby. Charities, £33. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
